poem:
Title: "On considering a Theologian-Novelist"

Words, like threads of soft gold,
weave from her pen,
each a creation, Genesis anew.
But a theologian, you say?
Perhaps a storyteller,
of human souls and divine whispers,
sweeping prose like cathedral bells,
Ringing clear in the dawn of this new century.
An unusual figure on society's canvas,
but aren't we all, in our own peculiar way.
